circumstances: The pilot took off from a gravel bar adjacent to the Alatna River, bound for Bettles. After departure, the single engine airplane encountered difficulties to gain height, struck trees and crashed in flames. The aircraft was destroyed by a post crash fire and the pilot, sole on board, was killed.
probable_cause:
Stall during initial climb due to  misuse of flaps. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Failed to obtain flying speed, 
- Misjudged distance, speed and altitude, 
- Failed to abort takeoff, 
- Loose gravel,
- High obstructions, 
- Downdrafts, updrafts,
- Obstructions to vision, 
- Evasive maneuver to avoid collision, 
- Takeoff from rvr gravel bar toward bend in river, 
- Trees, steep rvr bank at bend.
